com.magnet.android.mms.async

Interface Call<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The result type.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Future<T>

    public interface Call<T>
extends Future<T>
    This interface represents an asynchronous invocation to a controller. An instance of the Call is typically returned by a Controller method call, or CallManager.getCall(String). If the option is not specified in the Controller method call, an unreliable call will be assumed. For a reliable call, a Call instance will stay valid until dispose(), dispose(boolean) cancel(boolean), CallManager.disposeAllDoneCalls() or CallManager.cancelAllPendingCalls() is invoked. For an unreliable call, calling dispose() or dispose(boolean) is optional, but these methods allow developers to delete the cached response immediately.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        String getId()
        Retrieve the unique ID for this invocation.
        Returns:
        The unique ID for this invocation.

      • getToken

        String getToken()
        Retrieve the token specified in this call. The token is used to avoid duplicated invocations from the client.
        Returns:
        The token specified in this call, or null.

      • getState

        Call.State getState()
        Retrieve the state of this invocation. Reliable call states are Call.State.QUEUED, Call.State.EXECUTING, Call.State.SUCCESS, Call.State.FAILED, Call.State.TIMEDOUT or Call.State.CANCELLED. Unreliable call states are Call.State.EXECUTING, Call.State.SUCCESS, or Call.State.FAILED. The Call.State.INIT is the initial transient state.
        Returns:
        One of the State values, or null if the call has been disposed.

      • getResultTime

        Date getResultTime()
        Retrieve the result time only when the result is available.
        Returns:
        The time when the result was sent from the server, or null.

      • isResultFromCache

        boolean isResultFromCache()
        Indicates whether the result is retrieved from the cache. Combining with getResultTime(), the caller may inform users of the cache age.
        Returns:
        true if the result is retrieved from the cache; false otherwise.

      • resend

        boolean resend()
        Resend this request if its state is FAILED or TIMEDOUT. This operation is invalid if this Call instance has been disposed.
        Returns:
        true if it is resubmitted; false if this call has an invalid state.

      • dispose

        boolean dispose()
        Dispose this Call without clearing its result from cache. The call must be in a SUCCESS, FAILED or TIMEDOUT state. All resources used by this Call will be released. To dispose a queued or executing call, it must be cancelled first. This method is equivalent to dispose(boolean) with false.
        Returns:
        true for success; false if in an illegal state.

      • dispose

        boolean dispose(boolean clearResult)
        Dispose this Call and optionally clearing its result from cache. The call must be in SUCCESS, FAILED or TIMEDOUT state. All resources used by this Call will be released. The clearResult allows the caller to remove its result from the cache immediately; it is useful to any infrequent calls with large result data. But caution should be taken since it may delete the cached result for other concurrent similar calls.
        Parameters:
        clearResult - true to remove its result if exists.
        Returns:
        true for success; false if in an illegal state.

      • cancel

        boolean cancel(boolean mayInterruptIfRunning)
        Cancel a queued or executing call. If the call has been disposed, completed, cancelled, or is unable to cancel, it will return false. Upon successful completion, this call object will be disposed. There is no guarantee that the call can actually be cancelled; the system makes its best effort.
        Specified by:
        cancel in interface Future<T>
        Parameters:
        mayInterruptIfRunning - Set to true to permit interruption if the call is running; set to false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if cancellation is submitted; false if unable to cancel.

      • isCancelled

        boolean isCancelled()
        Indicates whether this task was cancelled before it completed normally. If the call has been disposed, it will return true.
        Specified by:
        isCancelled in interface Future<T>
        Returns:
        true if this task was cancelled before it completed; false otherwise.

      • isDone

        boolean isDone()
        Indicates whether this task completed. Completion may be due to normal termination, an exception, or cancellation; in all of these cases, this method will return true. If the call has been disposed, it will return true.
        Specified by:
        isDone in interface Future<T>
        Returns:
        true if this task completed or the call has been disposed; false otherwise.

      • getCause

        Throwable getCause()
        Retrieve the cause of the failure without using get() or get(long, TimeUnit). If the Call has been disposed, it will return null.
        Returns:
        The cause of the failure, or null if there was no error or the Call has been disposed.
        See Also:
        OAuthException, AuthenticationException, ConstraintException, CloudRuntimeException

      • get

        T get()
      throws InterruptedException,
             ExecutionException
        Waits, if necessary, for the computation to complete, and retrieves the result.
        Specified by:
        get in interface Future<T>
        Returns:
        The computed result.
        Throws:
        AutheticationException - If new authentication is required.
        OAuthException - if new OAuth is required.
        ConstraintException - If a constraint failed.
        CancellationException - if the computation was cancelled.
        ExecutionException - if the computation threw an exception.
        InterruptedException - if the current thread was interrupted while waiting.
        CloudRuntimeException - Server threw an exception.

      • get

        T get(long timeout,
    TimeUnit unit)
      throws InterruptedException,
             ExecutionException,
             TimeoutException
        Waits, if necessary, for at most the specified timeout period for the computation to complete, and then retrieves its result, if available.
        Specified by:
        get in interface Future<T>
        Parameters:
        timeout - The maximum time to wait.
        unit - The time unit of the timeout argument.
        Returns:
        The computed result.
        Throws:
        AutheticationException - If new authentication is required.
        OAuthException - If new OAuth is required.
        ConstraintException - If a constraint failed.
        CancellationException - if the computation was cancelled.
        ExecutionException - if the computation threw an exception.
        InterruptedException - if the current thread was interrupted while waiting.
        TimeoutException - if the wait timed out.
        CloudRuntimeException - Server threw an exception.
